BEGIN PERFECT HOUR SESSION
Title: 21. Social: Talking About Your Favorite Food and Why
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can describe my preferences and give a simple reason.
Context: You are at lunch with a colleague and discussing what you like to eat.
Correction: Helper will recast "I like pasta because good" to "I like pasta because it is delicious and easy to make."

PHASE 1: Fluency loop (10m)

* Say "My favorite food is..." five times.
* List five adjectives: "Delicious," "Spicy," "Sweet," "Healthy," "Fresh."
* Say "I don't like [Food] because..." three times.
AI helper script: I will name a food. You say "I like it" or "I don't like it" and give one reason from the list.

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "My favorite food is pizza. I like it because it has cheese and it is hot. I don't like salad because it is boring."
* Identify the connector "because."
* Repeat the helper's reasons for pizza and salad.

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Tell your colleague your favorite meal.
* Give two reasons why you like it.
* Ask the colleague what they think about a specific food (e.g., "Do you like fish?").
AI helper script: Act as a colleague. Ask "What are you eating?" and "Why do you like it?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "My favorite food is [Food]. I like it because it is [Adjective]. I don't like [Food] because it is [Adjective]."
* Listen: Did you pause too long before "because"?
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: 22. Daily Life: Asking a Neighbor to Borrow a Tool
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can make simple requests and respond to questions.
Context: You are doing a repair at home and need a ladder or hammer from your neighbor.
Correction: Helper will recast "Give me hammer" to "Could I borrow your hammer for an hour?"

PHASE 1: Fluency loop (10m)

* Say "Hammer," "Ladder," "Screwdriver," "Tape" five times each.
* Say "Could I borrow...?" five times.
* Practice "I will bring it back soon" three times.
AI helper script: I am your neighbor. Every time you ask to borrow something, I will say "Sure, here it is."

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "Hi! Could I borrow your ladder, please? I need to fix a light. I will bring it back this afternoon."
* Repeat the "bring it back" sentence three times.

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Knock on your neighbor's door and greet them.
* Ask for a tool and explain why you need it.
* Agree on a return time.
AI helper script: Act as a neighbor. Ask "Why do you need it?" and "When will you finish?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "Hi! Could I borrow your hammer? I need it for a chair. I will bring it back soon. Thank you!"
* Listen: Did you sound polite?
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: 23. Work: Describing What You Did Yesterday at Work
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give a simple description of a past event.
Context: You are at work talking to a colleague about your tasks from the previous day.
Correction: Helper will recast "I work ten hours" to "I worked for ten hours yesterday."

PHASE 1: Fluency loop (10m)

* Say "I worked," "I started," "I finished," "I talked" five times each.
* Say "Yesterday," "Last night," "In the morning."
AI helper script: I will say a verb in the present (e.g., "Call"). You say "Yesterday I called" immediately.

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "Yesterday was very busy. I started at eight. I cleaned the office and I talked to many customers. I finished at six."
* Listen for the "-ed" endings.

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Tell your colleague three things you did yesterday.
* Mention what time you started and finished.
* Answer a question about if yesterday was "good" or "bad."
AI helper script: Act as a colleague. Ask "How was work yesterday?" and "What time did you go home?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "Yesterday I worked. I cleaned the desk. I talked to my boss. I finished at five."
* Listen: Could you hear the past tense ending?
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: 24. Travel: Explaining Why Your Train Was Late
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate simple information about a problem and time.
Context: You arrive at a meeting late and have to explain the delay to your host.
Correction: Helper will recast "Train stop" to "I am sorry I'm late; the train was delayed by twenty minutes."

PHASE 1: Fluency loop (10m)

* Say "I am sorry I'm late" ten times.
* Say "The train was late," "The bus was late."
* Say "Twenty minutes," "One hour."
AI helper script: I am your host. Every time you arrive, you say "I'm sorry" and give a different time delay.

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "I’m very sorry I’m late. The train was delayed because of the rain. I waited for thirty minutes."
* Repeat the "because of the rain" phrase.

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Walk into the room and apologize immediately.
* Explain which transport you were on.
* State exactly how late you are.
AI helper script: Act as an annoyed host. Say "Finally! You are very late." Force me to explain the problem clearly.

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "I am sorry I am late. The train was delayed. I waited for twenty minutes. Thank you for waiting."
* Listen: Did you sound professional?
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: 25. Services: Booking a Hair Appointment
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate simple information about needs and schedule.
Context: You are calling a local salon to get a haircut.
Correction: Helper will recast "I want cut" to "I'd like to book an appointment for a haircut on Tuesday."

* Say "Haircut," "Wash," "Short," "Long" five times each.
* Practice times: "At two o'clock," "At half-past three."
AI helper script: I am a barber. You tell me a time, I say "I am busy." Suggest a time 30 minutes later.

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "Hello. I’d like a haircut, please. Are you free today at four? Five o'clock is great. My name is [Name]."
* Repeat "Are you free at...?" three times.

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Call the salon and ask for a haircut.
* Negotiate a time.
* Explain if you want a wash or just a cut.
AI helper script: Act as a receptionist. Ask "What time?" and "What is your phone number?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "I'd like a haircut today. Are you free at three o'clock? Okay, see you then."
* Listen: Was the time question clear?

* Say "It was about," "He was," "She was" five times.
AI helper script: I will name a movie genre. You tell me if you "watched it" and use one adjective.

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Repeat "It was about..." sentence.

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Tell your friend the name of a movie.
* Describe the genre and if you liked it.
* Tell them one thing that happened (simply).
AI helper script: Act as a friend. Ask "Who was in it?" and "Was it scary?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

Title: 27. Daily Life: Giving a Simple Recipe (3 Steps)
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give short, simple instructions for a familiar task.
Context: You are telling a friend how to make a simple snack like toast or tea.
Correction: Helper will recast "Put water, then hot" to "First, boil the water. Then, put the tea in the cup."

PHASE 1: Fluency loop (10m)

* Say "First," "Then," "Finally" ten times.
* Say "Boil," "Cut," "Mix," "Eat" five times.
AI helper script: I will say "First...". You say a cooking verb. Let's build a chain.

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "To make a sandwich, first take two pieces of bread. Then, put cheese inside. Finally, eat the sandwich."
* Identify the sequence words.

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Choose a snack or drink.
* Walk the helper through three steps using "First, Then, Finally."
AI helper script: Act as a hungry friend. Ask "Do I need a knife?" and "How long does it take?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "First, boil water. Then, put coffee in the cup. Finally, drink it. It is very easy."
* Listen: Did the order sound logical?
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: 29. Travel: Comparing Two Cities You Visited
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give simple descriptions and compare familiar places.
Context: You are talking to a colleague about two cities you saw on vacation.
Correction: Helper will recast "City A big, City B small" to "City A is bigger than City B, but City B is quieter."

PHASE 1: Fluency loop (10m)

* Say "Bigger," "Smaller," "Hotter," "Colder" five times each.
* Say "City A is... than City B" ten times.
AI helper script: I will name two things (e.g., "Car" and "Bike"). You say one comparison fast.

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "London is bigger than Oxford. London is very noisy, but Oxford is quieter. I like Oxford more."
* Listen for the "-er than" structure.

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Compare your hometown with the city you live in now.
* Use three comparative adjectives.
AI helper script: Act as a colleague. Ask "Which city is more expensive?" and "Which has better food?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "The city is bigger than my village. The village is quieter than the city. It is cheaper."
* Listen: Did you use "than" correctly?

AI helper script: Act as an agent. Ask "Is your neighbor's light on?" and tell me "It will be fixed in two hours."

Title: 32. Daily Life: Talking About Your Childhood Home
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give simple descriptions of a familiar place in the past.
Context: You are at dinner talking about where you lived as a child.
Correction: Helper will recast "My house small, many trees" to "My childhood home was small, but it had many trees."

PHASE 1: Fluency loop (10m)

* Say "I lived in," "My house was," "It had" five times each.
* List adjectives: "Big," "Small," "Old," "Quiet."
AI helper script: I will say a room (e.g., "Bedroom"). You say "My bedroom was [Adjective]."

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "When I was a child, I lived in a small village. My house was very old. It had a big kitchen and a red door."
* Listen for the past tense "lived/was/had."

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Describe the town or village where you grew up.
* Tell the helper two things the house "had" (e.g., a garden).
AI helper script: Act as a curious friend. Ask "Was it a big house?" and "Did you have a garden?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "I lived in a quiet town. My house was small, but it had a big garden. I liked it very much."
* Listen: Did you use "was" and "had" correctly?

Title: 34. Travel: Asking About the "Best" Way to Get to Town
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can ask for information and compare options.
Context: You are in a remote village and want to know if the bus or taxi is better.
Correction: Helper will recast "Bus or car better?" to "Is it better to take the bus or a taxi to the town center?"

PHASE 1: Fluency loop (10m)

* Say "Bus," "Taxi," "Better," "Faster," "Cheaper" five times.
* Say "Which is better?" five times.
AI helper script: I will name two transports. You say "The [A] is faster than the [B]."

PHASE 2: Model and input (20m)

* Helper models: "The bus is cheap, but it is slow. The taxi is faster, but more expensive. I think the bus is better."
* Listen for the contrast: "But."

PHASE 3: Simulation output (20m)

* Ask the helper how to get to the city.
* Ask which way is "faster."
* Decide which one you will take.
AI helper script: Act as a local. Give me two options. Ask "Are you in a hurry?"

PHASE 4: Record and focus (10m)

* Record: "Is the bus faster than the taxi? No? Okay. The bus is cheaper. I will take the bus."
* Listen: Did you use "than" correctly?

Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can handle media/authority questions and provide complex instructions in most demanding situations.
Context: You are a high-ranking academic. Your visa for a "Global Peace Summit" has been rejected at the border because they think your research is "Political." You are meeting with the Chief of Security.
Correction: Recast for "Diplomatic/Security" register; replacing "I'm just a teacher" with "my research constitutes a neutral sociological analysis with no partisan affiliation."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Political and Academic" terminology.
Human steps:

* Say "Neutral sociological analysis," "Partisan affiliation," "Intellectual freedom," and "Consular" five times each.
* Say "My presence is essential for the stabilization of the regional dialogue" three times.
AI helper script: I am a suspicious Chief of Security. I say "Your books say my government is bad. You are a spy!" You respond with a phrase that emphasizes "Objective Science" and "Global Peace."

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a model of high-stakes "Truth-Telling and Defense."
Human steps:

* Helper models a 60-second defense: "While the data is critical, the intent is constructive. My participation is sanctioned by the UN and represents a bridge between our nations."
* Identify the "Critical vs. Constructive" argument.
* Repeat the "sanctioned by the UN" phrase.
AI helper script: Act as a veteran crisis negotiator. Model how to talk to a "Soldier." Use C2 vocabulary: "sovereignty," "indemnity," "protocol," and "reconciliation."

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Secure a 24-hour "Transit Visa" and your passport back in 15 minutes.
Human steps:

* Explain the "Ecology of the Conflict" to the Chief to show why you are neutral.
* Negotiate a deal where you "Delete" one specific file (fictional) from your laptop to show good faith.
* Navigate the Chief's subtle "Pride" and "Grievances."
* Repeat the simulation, but now act as the "Soldier" who arrested you.
AI helper script: Act as the "Dangerous Chief" and the "Terrified Soldier." Be "Unpredictable." Force me to stay extremely calm and use "Careful Phrasing" to survive.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Analyze "Pacing under Pressure."
Human steps:

* Record your final message to your summit: "I have negotiated a temporary transit. The situation is volatile but stable. I will arrive by six PM. Over."
* Listen: Did your voice sound panicked?
* Write down the word "Partisan."
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the negotiation for better diplomatic weight. Give me a "can-do" check for avoiding controversy.

Twists:

* You realize the "Chief" is actually a fan of your work.
* Your computer battery dies halfway through the simulation.
* You find a "Spy" inside your own team.
* The Chief asks you to "Hide his family" in your car.
* You realize the "Conflict" was actually started by your own university.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Talking About Favorite Food
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can describe my likes and dislikes and give simple reasons.
Context: You are having lunch with a colleague and discussing what you like to eat.
Correction: The helper will recast "I like pasta because good" to "I like pasta because it is delicious and easy to make."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Build speed with preference phrases and food nouns.
Human steps:

* Say "My favorite food is..." five times with different foods.
* Say "I don't like..." three times with foods you dislike.
* Say "It is delicious" and "It is spicy" five times each.
AI helper script: I will name a food. You say "I like it" or "I don't like it" and give one adjective (e.g., "It's sweet"). Keep the pace very fast.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a simple description with reasons.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "My favorite food is pizza. I like it because it has cheese and it is hot. I don't like salad because it is boring."
* Identify the connector "because" in the sentences.
* Repeat the helper's reasons for pizza and salad.
* Practice saying "What is your favorite food?"
AI helper script: Model a simple preference dialogue. Use "I like... because..." and "I don't like... because..." Speak slowly. Use common A2 adjectives like "salty," "sweet," and "fresh."

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Discuss real food preferences in a conversation.
Human steps:

* Tell your colleague about your favorite meal.
* Give two reasons why you like it.
* Ask the colleague what they think about a specific food (e.g., "Do you like fish?").
* Repeat the conversation, but pretend you are a very picky eater.
AI helper script: Act as a colleague. I am eating lunch with you. Ask me: "What are you eating?" and "Do you like spicy food?" If I forget to give a reason, ask "Why?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Master the "because" connection.
Human steps:

* Record: "My favorite food is [Food]. I like it because it is [Adjective]. I don't like [Food] because it is [Adjective]."
* Listen: Did you pause too long before "because"?
* Write the two sentences in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the reason if the grammar was broken. Give me a "can-do" check for expressing preferences.

Twists:

* You are at a restaurant and the menu is only in a foreign language.
* You are allergic to your favorite food.
* The colleague offers you a food you hate.
* You are very hungry and want to order everything.
* You are trying to describe a traditional dish from your village.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Asking a Neighbor to Borrow a Tool
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can make simple requests and respond to questions.
Context: You are doing a repair at home and need to borrow a ladder or a hammer from your neighbor.
Correction: Helper will recast "Give me hammer" to "Could I borrow your hammer for an hour?"

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice tool names and polite requests.
Human steps:

* Say "Hammer," "Ladder," "Screwdriver," and "Tape" five times each.
* Say "Could I borrow...?" five times.
* Practice "I will bring it back soon" three times.
AI helper script: I am your neighbor. Every time you ask to borrow something, I will say "Sure, here it is." We will do this for five different tools to build speed.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a polite request and a promise.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hi! Could I borrow your ladder, please? I need to fix a light."
* Helper responds: "Yes, no problem. When can you bring it back?"
* Helper says: "I will bring it back this afternoon. Thank you!"
* Repeat the "bring it back" sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model a request to borrow an item. Include the reason (I need to fix...) and a specific time to return it. Speak clearly and slowly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully negotiate borrowing a tool.
Human steps:

* Knock on your neighbor's door and greet them.
* Ask for a specific tool and explain why you need it.
* Agree on a return time (e.g., "at five o'clock").
* Repeat the simulation, but the neighbor says they are using the tool right now.
AI helper script: Act as a neighbor. I have the tool. Ask me: "Why do you need it?" and "When will you finish?" If I am using it, make me suggest a later time.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Could I borrow."
Human steps:

* Record: "Hi! Could I borrow your hammer? I need it for a chair. I will bring it back soon. Thank you!"
* Listen: Did you sound polite and clear?
* Write "Borrow" and "Bring back" in your log.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the word "Borrow" if it sounded like "Lend." Provide a "can-do" check for the request.

Twists:

* The neighbor has a very big dog at the door.
* You broke the tool you borrowed last time.
* You need the tool for a whole week.
* The neighbor asks you to help them first.
* You don't know the name of the tool and have to describe it.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)

Context: You are at work talking to a colleague about what you did yesterday.
Correction: Helper will recast "I work ten hours" to "I worked for ten hours yesterday."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill past tense verbs.
Human steps:

* Say "I worked," "I started," "I finished," and "I talked" five times each.
* Say "Yesterday," "Last night," and "In the morning" five times each.
* Combine them: "Yesterday I worked."
AI helper script: I will say a verb in the present (e.g., "Call"). You say "Yesterday I called" as fast as you can. Let's do ten verbs.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a simple narrative of the past.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Yesterday was very busy. I started at eight. I cleaned the shop and I talked to many customers. I finished at six."
* Listen for the "-ed" endings on the verbs.
* Identify the three tasks the helper did yesterday.
* Repeat the "I finished at..." sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model a short report of yesterday's work. Use at least four past tense verbs. Speak clearly and emphasize the endings of the words.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20

Human steps:

* Tell your colleague three things you did at work yesterday.
* Mention what time you started and finished.

* Repeat the report, but pretend you had a very "lazy" day.
AI helper script: Act as a colleague. Ask me: "How was work yesterday?" and "What time did you go home?" If I use present tense for the past, recast it immediately.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus

Human steps:

* Write these four sentences in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the verbs to ensure the past tense is clear. Give me a "can-do" check for describing a past event.

Twists:

* You had a meeting that lasted three hours.

Title: Explaining a Late Train
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)

Context: You arrive at a meeting or work late and have to explain the train delay to your host.

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate apology and delay phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "I am sorry I'm late" ten times.
* Say "The train was late," "The bus was late," etc.
* Say "Twenty minutes," "Thirty minutes," "One hour."
AI helper script: I am your boss. Every time you arrive, you say "I'm sorry" and give a different time for the delay. I will say "That's okay."

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a polite explanation for lateness.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I’m very sorry I’m late. The train was delayed because of the rain. I waited for thirty minutes."

* Repeat the "I'm sorry I'm late" phrase with a sincere tone.
* Practice saying "The next train is..."
AI helper script: Model a conversation between a late guest and a host. Include an apology, the reason for the delay, and how long it took. Speak slowly.

* Repeat the simulation, but this time the host is a bit annoyed.

PHASE 4

Title: Booking a Hair Appointment
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate simple information about needs and schedule.
Context: You are calling a local barbershop or salon to get a haircut.
Correction: Helper will recast "I want cut" to "I'd like to book an appointment for a haircut on Tuesday."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill "Hair" vocabulary and times.
Human steps:

* Say "Haircut," "Wash," "Short," and "Long" five times each.
* Practice times: "At two o'clock," "At half-past three," "At four-fifteen."
* Say "Is anyone free?" three times.
AI helper script: I am a barber. You tell me a time, and I will say "I am busy then." You must suggest a time that is 30 minutes later.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a standard service booking.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hello. I’d like a haircut, please. Are you free today at four?"
* Helper responds: "No, but I am free at five o'clock. Is that okay?"
* Helper says: "Five o'clock is great. My name is [Name]."
* Repeat the "Are you free at...?" question three times.
AI helper script: Model a phone call for a haircut. Include the request, the negotiation of time, and giving a name. Speak at a slow, professional speed.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully schedule a grooming service.
Human steps:

* Call the "salon" and ask for a haircut.
* Negotiate a time that works for you.
* Explain if you want a "wash" or just a "cut."
* Repeat the simulation, but book for two people (you and a friend).
AI helper script: Act as a salon receptionist. Ask me: "What time?" and "What is your phone number?" Tell me "We are very busy today" to see if I suggest tomorrow.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Are you free at...?"
Human steps:

* Record: "I'd like a haircut today. Are you free at three o'clock? Okay, see you then. My name is [Name]."
* Listen: Was the time question clear?
* Write the appointment details in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the word "Haircut" for the 'air' sound. Give a "can-do" check for the booking.

Twists:

* You are 10 minutes late for the appointment.
* You want a very specific style (e.g., "Very short").
* You want to know the price first.
* The salon only takes cash.
* You need to cancel the appointment later.

Title: Giving a Simple Recipe (3 Steps)
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give short, simple instructions for a familiar task.
Context: You are telling a friend how to make your favorite simple snack (like toast or tea).
Correction: Helper will recast "Put water, then hot" to "First, boil the water. Then, put the tea in the cup."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate cooking verbs and sequence words.
Human steps:

* Say "First," "Then," and "Finally" ten times each.
* Say "Boil," "Cut," "Mix," and "Eat" five times each.
* Practice "It is easy" three times.
AI helper script: I will say "First...". You say a cooking verb. Then I say "Then...". You say another verb. Let's do this fast for three different "dishes."

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a sequenced recipe.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "To make a sandwich, first take two pieces of bread. Then, put cheese inside. Finally, eat the sandwich."
* Identify the three steps.
* Repeat the sequence words: First, Then, Finally.
* Practice saying "Is it good?" after the helper models it.
AI helper script: Model a three-step recipe for something simple. Use "First," "Then," and "Finally." Speak slowly and use hand gestures for the actions.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Teach a simple recipe to a friend.
Human steps:

* Choose a snack or drink you know how to make.
* Walk the helper through the three steps using "First, Then, Finally."
* Answer the helper's question about if you need salt or sugar.
* Repeat the instructions, but try to use more specific verbs (e.g., "fry" instead of "cook").
AI helper script: Act as a friend who is hungry. I am following your recipe. Ask me: "Do I need a knife?" and "How long does it take?" If I skip a step, say "Wait, what's next?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on sequence markers.
Human steps:

* Record: "First, boil water. Then, put coffee in the cup. Finally, drink it. It is very easy."
* Listen: Did the order of steps sound clear?
* Write your 3-step recipe in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the verbs for better accuracy. Give a "can-do" check for providing instructions.

Twists:

* You don't have one of the ingredients.
* The recipe is "secret."
* Your friend is a bad cook and asks too many questions.
* You are in a rush.
* The snack is "too spicy" for your friend.

* Request a table in a specific location (e.g., "Near the window").
* Explain why you don't want the first table they offer you.
* Repeat the simulation, but this time you are with your "Grandparents."
AI helper script: Act as a waiter. Offer me a table next to a loud group of people. Ask: "Is this table okay?" Force me to say "No, it's too noisy" and ask for another one.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Too [Adjective]."
Human steps:

* Record: "Could we have a quiet table, please? This table is too loud. We want to talk. Thank you!"
* Listen: Was the "too" clear before the adjective?
* Write "Quiet" and "Loud" in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the word "Quiet" for the 'qu' sound. Give a "can-do" check for the request.

Twists:

* The restaurant is completely full.
* You have to wait 20 minutes for a quiet table.
* You want a table outside.
* You are meeting a very important person.
* The waiter doesn't understand "Quiet."

Title: Inviting a Neighbor for Dinner
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can make and respond to simple invitations.
Context: You see your neighbor in the hallway and want to invite them to your home for a meal.
Correction: Helper will recast "You come eat?" to "Would you like to come over for dinner on Friday?"

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate invitation phrases and days of the week.
Human steps:

* Say "Would you like to come for dinner?" five times.
* List the days of the week (Monday through Sunday) three times.
* Say "I am cooking chicken" or "I am making pasta" five times.
AI helper script: I am your neighbor. Every time I say "Hello," you invite me for dinner on a specific day. I will say "I'm busy," then you must suggest a different day.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a polite invitation and scheduling exchange.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hi! Would you like to have dinner at my house on Saturday?"
* Helper responds: "That sounds great, but I'm busy. How about Sunday?"
* Helper says: "Sunday is perfect. See you at seven."
* Repeat the "How about...?" question three times.
AI helper script: Model a short dialogue where one person invites another, handles a rejection, and agrees on a new time. Use simple A2 connectors like "but" and "how about."

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully schedule a dinner date.
Human steps:

* Greet your neighbor and make the invitation.
* Suggest a specific time and mention what you are cooking.
* If the neighbor is busy, suggest a different day or time.
* Confirm the final plan.
AI helper script: Act as my neighbor. I am inviting you to dinner. At first, be busy. Force me to suggest a new day. Ask me "What time?" and "What are you cooking?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Record the final confirmed invitation.
Human steps:

* Record: "Would you like to come for dinner on Friday at eight? I am making fish. See you then!"
* Listen: Did you say the day and time clearly?
* Write the invitation in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the time or day if they were hard to hear. Give me a "can-do" check for the invitation.

Twists:

* The neighbor is a vegetarian.
* The neighbor wants to bring a friend.
* You realize you are busy on the day you suggested.
* The neighbor asks for your address.
* You want the neighbor to bring the drinks.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

BEGIN PERFECT HOUR SESSION
Title: Describing Your Home to a Guest
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give a simple description of a familiar place.
Context: A friend is visiting your home for the first time and you are showing them around.
Correction: Helper will recast "This kitchen" to "This is the kitchen; it is small but bright."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill rooms and simple adjectives.
Human steps:

* Say "Kitchen," "Bedroom," "Living room," and "Bathroom" five times each.
* Say "It is big," "It is small," "It is new," and "It is old" five times each.
* Combine them: "The kitchen is big."
AI helper script: I will name a room. You give me a one-sentence description using an adjective (e.g., "The bedroom is quiet").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a simple house tour.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "This is the living room. It has a big window. Over there is the kitchen."
* Helper points and describes: "The bathroom is next to the bedroom."
* Identify the location words: "Next to," "Over there," "Inside."
* Repeat the "Next to" sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model a house tour. Use "This is," "It has," and prepositions of place (next to, across from). Speak slowly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Give a tour of your actual or an imaginary home.
Human steps:

* Walk the helper through three rooms.
* Describe one thing in each room (e.g., "The bed is big").
* Answer the guest's question about where the bathroom is.
* Repeat the tour, but make it faster.
AI helper script: Act as a guest in my house. I am showing you around. Ask: "Where is the bathroom?" and "Do you like the kitchen?" and "Is the house old?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on prepositions of place.
Human steps:

* Record: "This is my home. The kitchen is next to the living room. The bedroom is small. Welcome!"
* Listen: Did you use "next to" correctly?
* Write down your three favorite house adjectives.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the prepositions if they were missing. Provide a "can-do" check for the description.

Twists:

* The house is very messy.
* You are living in a tiny apartment.
* You have a very large garden.
* One room is under renovation.
* The guest is allergic to cats (and you have one).
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Reporting Progress to a Supervisor
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give a simple report on a familiar task.
Context: You are at work and your manager asks "How is the project going?"
Correction: Helper will recast "I do half" to "I have finished half of the work."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Work Status" verbs.
Human steps:

* Say "I am working on it," "I have finished," and "I need more time" five times each.
* Say "It will be ready at four" three times.
* Practice "Are there any problems?" twice.
AI helper script: I am your manager. Every two minutes, I will ask "Is it done?" You must give me a different status update each time.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a clear status report.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I have finished the cleaning. Now, I am starting the windows. I will finish at five o'clock."
* Identify the sequence: Finished -> Doing Now -> Finish Time.
* Repeat the three-part status report.
AI helper script: Model a three-step work update. Use "I have finished," "I am [verb]ing," and "I will finish at..." Speak clearly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully update your boss on your tasks.
Human steps:

* Tell your boss what you completed this morning.
* Explain what you are doing right now.
* Estimate when you will be completely finished.
* Repeat the simulation, but tell the boss you have a problem and need help.
AI helper script: Act as a supervisor. Ask me: "What are you doing now?" and "When will it be ready?" If I have a problem, ask "How can I help you?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on present perfect vs. present continuous.
Human steps:

* Record: "I have finished the report. I am writing the email now. I will be done in ten minutes."
* Listen: Did you distinguish between "have finished" and "am writing"?
* Write these two sentences in your log.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the verb tenses if they were mixed up. Give me a "can-do" check for the report.

Twists:

* The computer broke.
* You need to leave early today.
* You finished everything already.
* You made a mistake and have to restart.
* A colleague is helping you.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Asking for a Refund in a Shop
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can make a simple complaint and request a specific result.
Context: You bought a shirt that has a hole in it, and you are taking it back to the store.
Correction: Helper will recast "Shirt bad, money me" to "This shirt is damaged. I would like a refund, please."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill "Problem and Solution" nouns.
Human steps:

* Say "Broken," "Damaged," and "Wrong size" five times each.
* Say "I want a refund" and "I want to exchange this" five times each.
* Practice "Here is my receipt" three times.
AI helper script: I am a shop clerk. Every time you show me an "item," you tell me one thing wrong with it. I will say "I'm sorry."

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a simple retail complaint.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hello. I bought this yesterday. It is broken. Can I have a refund?"
* Helper responds: "Do you have the receipt?"
* Helper says: "Yes, here it is."
* Repeat the question "Can I have a refund?" after the helper.
AI helper script: Model the return process. Greet, state problem, show receipt, ask for money back. Speak slowly and use a piece of paper as a receipt.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully get your money back.
Human steps:

* Approach the "clerk" and explain the problem with the item.
* Offer the receipt before they ask for it.
* Insist on a refund if they offer an exchange first.
* Repeat the simulation, but this time you lost the receipt.
AI helper script: Act as a store clerk. Be polite but ask "Do you want to change it for a new one?" Force me to say "No, I want my money back."

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "I would like."
Human steps:

* Record: "This item is damaged. I have the receipt. I would like a refund, please. Thank you."
* Listen: Was the "would like" clear and polite?
* Write "Refund" and "Receipt" in your log.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast "damaged" or "refund" if the pronunciation was unclear. Give a "can-do" check for the complaint.

Twists:

* The store is very busy.
* The clerk says "No refunds, only exchange."
* You bought it a month ago.
* The manager is not there.
* You want to buy something else with the money.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Booking a Hotel Room (Phone)
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate simple information about needs.
Context: You are calling a hotel to book a room for two nights next week.
Correction: Helper will recast "I want sleep" to "I'd like to book a room for two people."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill dates, numbers, and "Room" types.
Human steps:

* Say "Single room" and "Double room" five times each.
* Practice dates: "June first," "June second," "June third."
* Say "How much per night?" five times.
AI helper script: I am a hotel clerk. You tell me a day and I will say "We are full." You must suggest the next day.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a standard booking sequence.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hello. I’d like a room for two nights, please."
* Helper responds: "For which dates?"
* Helper says: "For Friday and Saturday. How much is it?"
* Repeat "For two nights, please" three times.
AI helper script: Model a booking call. Include the request, the dates, the price, and the name for the reservation. Speak at a steady, slow pace.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully reserve a room.
Human steps:

* Call the hotel and state your request.
* Specify the number of people and the exact dates.
* Ask about breakfast (e.g., "Is breakfast included?").
* Repeat the simulation, but ask for the cheapest room available.
AI helper script: Act as a hotel receptionist. Ask me: "What is your name?" and "How many people?" Tell me the price is high to see if I ask for a different room.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "I'd like to."
Human steps:

* Record: "I'd like to book a double room for Tuesday. How much is it? Is breakfast included? Thank you."
* Listen: Did you use "I'd like to" correctly?
* Write the price and dates in your log.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the dates if they sounded like other numbers. Give a "can-do" check for the reservation.

Twists:

* There is only one bed.
* The hotel has no Wi-Fi.
* You need a late check-in.
* You want a room with a view.
* You have to give your credit card number (fake it).
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Talking About Your Weekend Hobbies
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can ask and answer simple questions about familiar topics.
Context: You are talking to a new friend at a park about what you do for fun.
Correction: Helper will recast "I play soccer weekend" to "I usually play soccer on the weekend."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice hobby verbs and frequency adverbs.
Human steps:

* Say "I usually," "I sometimes," and "I always" five times each.
* List three hobbies (e.g., "I read books," "I cook," "I walk").
* Say "It is very fun" three times.
AI helper script: I will ask "What do you do on Saturday?" and you give me a different hobby each time using "usually" or "sometimes."

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a description of free time.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "On the weekend, I usually go to the market. Sometimes, I watch a movie. I always drink coffee on Sunday."
* Listen for the adverbs: Usually, Sometimes, Always.
* Identify the three activities the helper mentioned.
* Repeat the "sometimes" sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model a description of your weekend. Use "usually," "sometimes," and "always" with A2-level activities. Speak at a natural but slow speed.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Share your real interests with a friend.
Human steps:

* Tell the helper about your favorite weekend activity.
* Use "usually" and "sometimes" to describe your routine.
* Ask the helper: "What do you do for fun?"
* Repeat the simulation, but pretend you have a hobby you hate.
AI helper script: Act as a new friend. I am asking about your hobbies. Ask me follow-up questions like "Where do you do that?" or "Who do you play with?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on frequency adverb placement.
Human steps:

* Record: "I usually play soccer on Saturday. Sometimes I cook for my family. It is very fun."
* Listen: Did you put "usually" before the verb?
* Write your top three hobby sentences in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the frequency words if they were in the wrong place. Give me a "can-do" check for the hobby talk.

Twists:

* Your hobby is very expensive.
* You have no free time because of work.
* You do your hobby alone.
* It is raining, so you can't do your hobby today.
* You want to start a new hobby.

Title: Grocery Shopping for a Recipe
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can make simple requests and handle money.
Context: You are at a grocery store and cannot find the two ingredients you need for a specific dish.
Correction: Helper will recast "Where rice?" to "Excuse me, where can I find the rice?"

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill ingredient names and "Where is."
Human steps:

* Say "Rice," "Oil," "Salt," and "Sugar" five times each.
* Say "Where is the...?" ten times while pointing.
* Say "I am looking for..." five times.
AI helper script: I am a store worker. You name an ingredient, and I will point in a direction. This is for speed and vocabulary.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a request for help in a store.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Excuse me. I am looking for olive oil. Where is it?"
* Helper responds: "It is in aisle four, next to the bread."
* Helper points and says: "Over there."
* Repeat "Next to the bread" three times.
AI helper script: Model a store interaction. Customer asks for two different items. Clerk gives locations using "next to" or "behind." Speak slowly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Find all the items for your meal.
Human steps:

* Approach the helper and say what you are cooking (e.g., "I am making soup").
* Ask for the location of two specific ingredients.
* Repeat the directions back to the helper to confirm.
* Repeat the simulation, but ask for the price of one item.
AI helper script: Act as a grocery clerk. I will ask for help. Give me specific directions (e.g., "Aisle 3" or "Near the milk"). If I look lost, ask "Do you need a bag?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "I am looking for."
Human steps:

* Record: "Excuse me. I am looking for rice and salt. Where are they? Aisle two? Thank you."
* Listen: Did you use "Where are they" for plural items?
* Write the aisle numbers in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the plural/singular grammar if needed. Provide a "can-do" check for finding the items.

Twists:

* The store is out of one ingredient.
* You need a very large amount (10kg).
* You can't read the signs.
* The item is "too expensive."
* You find a "New" ingredient and ask what it is.

Title: Introducing a New Team Member
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give and ask for basic personal/professional information.
Context: You are at the office and a new person has joined your team today.
Correction: Helper will recast "He is Mark" to "This is Mark, he is our new designer."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate introduction and job-related phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "This is [Name]," "He is a [Job]," and "She is a [Job]" five times each.
* Say "Nice to meet you" and "Welcome to the team" five times each.
* Practice "Where did you work before?" twice.
AI helper script: I will say a name and a job. You introduce that person to an imaginary group. Let's do five different people.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a professional introduction.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hi everyone. This is Sarah. She is our new accountant. She worked at a bank before."
* Identify the three pieces of info: Name, Job, Past Experience.
* Repeat the "She worked at... before" sentence.
* Practice saying "Welcome, Sarah!"
AI helper script: Model a team introduction. Include name, job title, and one small detail about the person's past. Speak at a welcoming, steady pace.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Introduce the new person and make small talk.
Human steps:

* Introduce the "new member" (the helper) to your team.
* Ask the new person one question about their background.
* Tell them one thing about your own job.
* Repeat the simulation, but now you are the one being introduced.
AI helper script: Act as a new team member. I am meeting you for the first time. Ask me: "What is your job?" and "Do you like it here?" Tell me something about the office coffee.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "He is / She is" consistency.
Human steps:

* Record: "This is [Name]. He is a mechanic. He worked in a big shop before. Welcome to our team!"
* Listen: Did you use "he" or "she" correctly throughout?
* Write down your own professional introduction (3 sentences).
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the gender pronouns if they were mixed up. Give me a "can-do" check for the introduction.

Twists:

* You forget the person's name.
* The new person is the "Boss."
* The new person doesn't speak your language well.
* There are three new people at once.
* You have to show them where their desk is.

Title: Dealing with a Bad Internet Connection
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate simple information about a problem.
Context: Your home internet is not working and you are calling tech support.
Correction: Helper will recast "Web no work" to "My internet connection is very slow/not working."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill technology and status words.
Human steps:

* Say "Slow," "Not working," "Broken," and "Disconnected" five times each.
* Say "I need internet for work" three times.
* Practice "Can you check my account?" five times.
AI helper script: I am a tech support agent. Every time I say "What is the problem?", you give me a different symptom (e.g., "The red light is blinking," "It is very slow").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a simple tech support call.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hello. My internet is not working. The router has a red light."
* Helper responds: "Okay. Please restart the router."
* Helper says: "I did that, but it is still not working."
* Identify the instruction: "Restart the router."
AI helper script: Model a call. Include the greeting, the account number (fake), the symptom, and the restart instruction. Speak clearly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully report the issue and understand instructions.
Human steps:

* Call the helper and explain that your internet is down.
* Provide your "account number" when asked.
* Follow the helper's instructions to "unplug and wait."
* Repeat the simulation, but tell the agent you need it fixed "now" for a meeting.
AI helper script: Act as a tech support agent. Ask for a name and address. Give three instructions: 1. Turn it off. 2. Wait. 3. Turn it on. Tell me "A technician will come tomorrow."

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Still not working."
Human steps:

* Record: "My internet is slow. I restarted the router, but it is still not working. When can you fix it? Thank you."
* Listen: Was the "still" used correctly to show a continuing problem?
* Write the technician's arrival time in your log.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the technical words (router, connection). Give a "can-do" check for reporting the problem.

Twists:

* You are calling for your neighbor.
* You don't have your account number.
* The agent is very rude.
* The internet suddenly starts working during the call.
* You have to pay for the repair.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Giving Directions to a Local Landmark
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can provide short, simple instructions for a route.
Context: A tourist in your town asks you how to get to the main church or the central market.
Correction: Helper will recast "Go church" to "Go straight and turn left at the park."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate direction and landmark words.
Human steps:

* Say "Go straight," "Turn left," and "Turn right" ten times each.
* List three local landmarks (e.g., "The park," "The school," "The church").
* Say "It is on the corner" three times.
AI helper script: I am a tourist. Every 30 seconds, I will name a place. You give me one direction (e.g., "Turn left at the school").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a three-step direction sequence.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Go straight for two blocks. Turn right at the park. The church is across from the cafe."
* Listen for the transition words: "First," "Then," "Next to."
* Identify the landmark the helper mentioned.
* Repeat the "across from" sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model directions for a simple route. Use "First," "Then," and "Next to/Across from." Speak slowly and use hand gestures.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully guide a stranger to a destination.
Human steps:

* Imagine a real place in your town.
* Give the helper a three-step direction to get there.
* Use a landmark (like a tree or a shop) to make it easier.
* Repeat the simulation, but this time the tourist is very confused.
AI helper script: Act as a lost tourist. Ask me for directions to the "Market." Interrupt me with "Wait, left or right?" and "Is it far?" Force me to repeat the steps.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on the "at the [Landmark]" structure.
Human steps:

* Record: "Go straight. Turn right at the park. The market is next to the school. It is not far."
* Listen: Was the preposition "at" used correctly for the turn?
* Draw a simple map in your notebook based on your recording.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the landmark prepositions if needed. Give a "can-do" check for providing instructions.

Twists:

* The road is closed.
* It is too far to walk; they need a bus.
* The landmark has a new name.
* The tourist is in a car, not walking.
* You realize you gave the wrong directions and have to correct yourself.

Title: Declining an Invitation Politely
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can make and respond to simple invitations/requests.
Context: A friend invites you to a party on Saturday night, but you have to work.
Correction: Helper will recast "I no go" to "I'm sorry, I can't come because I'm busy."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice apology and "Reason" phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "I'm sorry," "I can't come," and "Maybe next time" five times each.
* List three reasons (e.g., "I'm working," "I'm tired," "I'm sick").
* Say "Thank you for asking" three times.
AI helper script: I am a friend inviting you to things (Cinema, Dinner, Park). You must refuse every invitation and give a different reason each time.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a polite refusal and alternative.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Do you want to come to my party on Friday?"
* Helper responds: "I’d love to, but I have to work. How about Saturday?"
* Helper says: "Saturday is good. See you then."
* Identify the "Alternative" suggestion.
* Repeat "I'd love to, but..." three times.
AI helper script: Model a polite refusal. Include an apology, a reason using "because," and a suggestion for a different day. Speak at a warm, friendly speed.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Navigate a social "No" without being rude.
Human steps:

* Listen to the helper's invitation.
* Refuse politely and give your real or a fake reason.
* Suggest a "Rain check" (meeting a different day).
* Repeat the simulation, but this time the friend is very pushy.
AI helper script: Act as a friend. I am inviting you to a concert. When you say no, say "Oh please! It will be so fun!" Force me to stay firm but polite.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "because" to link the reason.
Human steps:

* Record: "I'm sorry, I can't come on Friday because I am working. Can we meet on Sunday? Thank you for asking!"
* Listen: Did you sound genuinely sorry?
* Write "I can't come because..." in your log.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the reason sentence for better flow. Give a "can-do" check for the refusal.

Twists:

* You actually *do* want to go but you really can't.
* You don't like the person and want to be very short.
* The party is for your boss.
* You realize later that you *are* free and have to call them back.
* You offer to come "late" instead of not at all.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Describing Your Family Members
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can ask and answer simple questions about familiar topics.
Context: You are showing a new colleague photos of your family during a break.
Correction: Helper will recast "My brother name Sam" to "My brother's name is Sam; he is very tall."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice possessives and physical descriptions.
Human steps:

* Say "My mother's name is," "My father's name is," etc.
* List five physical traits (Tall, Short, Young, Old, Happy).
* Say "He lives in [Place]" three times.
AI helper script: I am a colleague. I will name a family role (e.g., "Sister"). You tell me one thing about her (e.g., "My sister is a teacher").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a detailed family description.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "This is my brother. His name is John. He is a mechanic and he lives in the city. He is very tall."
* Identify the four details: Name, Job, Location, Physical trait.
* Repeat the description of the brother.
* Practice saying "His name is" and "Her name is."
AI helper script: Model a description of two family members. Use "His" and "Her" correctly. Include names and simple jobs. Speak at a slow, descriptive speed.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Talk about your real family in detail.
Human steps:

* Describe two people in your family to the helper.
* Mention their names, what they do, and where they live.
* Answer the helper's question about how old they are.
* Repeat the simulation, but talk about your "Dream Family" (fake).
AI helper script: Act as a colleague. Ask me: "How many brothers do you have?" and "Is your mother a teacher?" and "Where do they live?" If I use "His" for a woman, recast it immediately.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "His" vs "Her."
Human steps:

* Record: "My mother's name is Maria. She is a nurse. My father's name is Sam. He is tall. They live in a small town."
* Listen: Did you get the "His/Her" and "He/She" right?
* Write a 3-sentence summary of one family member.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast any pronoun errors. Provide a "can-do" check for describing family.

Twists:

* You have a very large family (10 people).
* Your family lives in another country.
* You have a twin.
* You don't have a photo and have to describe them from memory.
* The colleague thinks your brother is "handsome."
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Explaining How to Use a Basic Tool
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give short, simple instructions for a familiar task.
Context: You are showing a new worker how to use a hammer, a kettle, or a stapler.
Correction: Helper will recast "Push this" to "First, you must push this button."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate imperatives and "Safety" words.
Human steps:

* Say "Push," "Pull," "Turn," and "Press" ten times each.
* Say "Be careful" and "Don't touch this" five times.
* Practice "Like this" while gesturing.
AI helper script: I am a new worker. Every time you say a verb (e.g., "Press"), I will say "Okay." We will do this fast to build instructional rhythm.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a sequenced instruction.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "To make tea, first put water in the kettle. Then, press the button. Finally, wait for the light."
* Listen for the sequence words: "First," "Then," "Finally."
* Identify the three steps in the instruction.
* Repeat the "Finally, wait..." sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model a three-step instruction for a simple tool (e.g., a coffee machine or a drill). Use "First," "Then," and "Finally." Use hand gestures.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully train a colleague on a tool.
Human steps:

* Choose a tool you use every day.
* Explain the three steps to use it safely.
* Warn the worker about one thing they "should not" do.
* Repeat the simulation, but the worker is doing it wrong and you must correct them.
AI helper script: Act as a new worker. I am learning from you. Ask: "Is this right?" (and pretend to do it wrong). Force me to say "No, do it like this" and repeat the instruction.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on sequence markers (First/Then).
Human steps:

* Record: "First, open the box. Then, put the paper inside. Finally, close the lid. Be careful!"
* Listen: Did the steps sound logical?
* Write the three "Action Verbs" you used.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the verbs for better precision. Give a "can-do" check for giving instructions.

Twists:

* The tool is broken.
* You are in a noisy factory.
* The worker is very afraid of the machine.
* You have to explain it without using your hands (words only).
* The "Instruction Manual" is in a different language.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Asking About Gym Membership
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can ask for basic information and compare simple prices.
Context: You are at the front desk of a local gym in a town.
Correction: Helper will recast "Gym how much?" to "I'm interested in joining. How much is a monthly membership?"

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Health and Finance" words.
Human steps:

* Say "Membership," "Monthly," "Daily," and "Free" five times each.
* Say "Does it have a pool?" and "Are there classes?" three times each.
* Practice "I want to start tomorrow" twice.
AI helper script: I am a gym worker. You ask me "Does it have...?" and I will say "Yes" or "No." Let's do this for ten different gym features.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a comparison of two gym plans.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "The basic plan is twenty dollars. The premium plan is forty dollars. It includes the pool and the sauna."
* Listen for the prices and the word "includes."
* Identify the difference between the two plans.
* Repeat "The basic plan is twenty dollars" three times.
AI helper script: Model a conversation between a customer and a gym clerk. Use B1-level descriptors like "basic," "premium," "inclusive," and "discount." Speak slowly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Determine the best plan for your budget and goals.
Human steps:

* Ask the clerk for the prices of the different plans.
* Ask about the opening hours (e.g., "When do you open?").
* Negotiate a "Free Trial" or a discount for being a student/senior.
* Repeat the simulation, but tell the clerk the price is "too expensive."
AI helper script: Act as a gym receptionist. Give me two options. If I say it's expensive, offer me a "Weekend Only" plan or a "Day Pass." Ask me: "What is your goal?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Does it have...?"
Human steps:

* Record: "How much is the monthly plan? Does it have a pool? Okay, I want to join. Thank you."
* Listen: Did you use "Does it have" correctly for the question?
* Write the gym's opening hours in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the question if the word order was wrong. Give a "can-do" check for getting information.

Twists:

* You want to bring a friend for free.
* The gym is only for women or men.
* You need a locker.
* You want to cancel your old membership.
* The gym is "too crowded" when you visit.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Reporting Lost Luggage
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate simple information about a problem and provide personal info.
Context: You are at the "Lost and Found" desk at an airport because your suitcase did not arrive.
Correction: Helper will recast "Bag gone" to "I can't find my suitcase. It is a large black bag."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill "Luggage" adjectives and travel nouns.
Human steps:

* Say "Suitcase," "Backpack," "Black," "Red," "Large," and "Small" five times each.
* Say "I was on flight [Number]" five times.
* Practice "When will it arrive?" three times.
AI helper script: I am a baggage agent. I will ask "What color?" and "What size?" You give me a different combination each time as fast as you can.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a lost baggage report.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hello. My bag is missing. I was on the flight from Paris. It is a large blue suitcase with wheels."
* Identify the three details: Origin, size/color, and features (wheels).
* Repeat the description of the blue suitcase.
* Practice saying your flight number clearly.
AI helper script: Model a report to a baggage clerk. Include the flight number, a description of the bag, and the local address for delivery. Speak slowly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully file a claim and provide delivery details.
Human steps:

* Approach the "clerk" and state your problem.
* Describe your bag using at least three adjectives.
* Give the helper your address or hotel name for the delivery.
* Repeat the simulation, but this time you are very angry because the bag has your medicine.
AI helper script: Act as a baggage clerk. Ask: "Which flight?" and "What does it look like?" If I am too vague, ask "Is it hard or soft?" Tell me "We will call you tomorrow."

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on adjectives before nouns.
Human steps:

* Record: "My bag is missing. It is a small red backpack. I am at the Hilton Hotel. Please call me. Thank you."
* Listen: Did you say "red backpack" or "backpack red"?
* Write your "Bag Description" in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the adjective order if it was wrong. Provide a "can-do" check for the report.

Twists:

* You have two missing bags.
* Your bag is "unique" (it has a sticker or a ribbon).
* You are in a different city than your bag.
* The clerk doesn't find your name in the computer.
* You realize you took someone else's bag by mistake.

Title: Describing Your Daily Routine
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can describe a simple daily routine.
Context: You are talking to a classmate or co-worker about your typical Monday.
Correction: Helper will recast "I eat breakfast then work" to "I eat breakfast and then I go to work."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate routine verbs and time markers.
Human steps:

* Say "I wake up," "I eat," "I work," and "I sleep" five times each.
* Say "At seven o'clock," "At eight o'clock," etc.
* Say "And then..." five times.
AI helper script: I will say a time. You tell me one thing you usually do at that time (e.g., "7 AM" -> "I wake up").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a sequenced daily routine.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I wake up at six. I drink coffee and then I go to the gym. I start work at nine."
* Listen for the connector "and then."
* Identify the three actions the helper does.
* Repeat the full routine three times after the helper models it.
AI helper script: Model your daily routine. Use "at [time]" and "and then." Include at least four activities. Speak clearly and slowly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Describe your real day and answer a question.
Human steps:

* Tell the helper your routine from waking up to starting work.
* Use "at" for every time you mention.
* Respond to the helper's question about what you eat for lunch.
* Repeat the routine, but for your "Perfect Day" (fake).
AI helper script: Act as a curious friend. I am listening to your routine. Ask: "What time do you finish?" and "Do you eat at home?" If I skip the "at," recast it.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "At" for time.
Human steps:

* Record: "I wake up at seven. I work at nine. I eat lunch at one. Then I go home."
* Listen: Was the "at" clear in every sentence?
* Write your 4-step routine in your log.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the times if they were hard to hear. Give a "can-do" check for describing a routine.

Twists:

* You work a night shift.
* You have a very short lunch.
* You do something different on weekends.
* You are very busy and have no time for breakfast.
* You share your routine with a roommate.

Title: Ordering a Taxi over the Phone
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate simple information about needs and locations.
Context: You are in a remote village and need a taxi to take you to the nearest city station.
Correction: Helper will recast "I want car" to "I would like to order a taxi to [Location], please."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill location names and "Now" vs "Later."
Human steps:

* Say "I need a taxi," "To the station," and "As soon as possible" five times each.
* Say your address five times clearly.
* Practice "How much?" and "When?" three times.
AI helper script: I am a taxi dispatcher. You give me a location and I will say "Ten minutes." We will repeat this with five different locations.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a standard taxi booking call.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Hello. I’d like a taxi to the airport, please. I am at number five, Main Street."
* Helper responds: "Okay. The taxi will be there in five minutes. It costs twenty dollars."
* Identify the address and the time the helper used.
* Repeat the "I'd like a taxi to..." sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model a call. Include the destination, the current address, the wait time, and the price. Speak at a professional, clear pace.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully book a ride for a specific time.
Human steps:

* Call the helper and request a taxi for "Now."
* State your address clearly and spell the street name if needed.
* Ask for the price to the destination.
* Repeat the simulation, but book the taxi for "Tomorrow at 6 AM."
AI helper script: Act as a taxi dispatcher. Ask: "Where are you?" and "Where are you going?" If the learner is too quiet, say "I can't hear you, what is the address?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on address clarity.
Human steps:

* Record: "I would like a taxi to the station. I am at [Address]. How much is it? Thank you."
* Listen: Was the address easy to understand?
* Write the taxi price and time in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the address for better pronunciation. Provide a "can-do" check for the booking.

Twists:

* There are no taxis available for an hour.
* You have a lot of heavy boxes.
* The price is "too high" and you try to negotiate.
* You are in a very noisy place.
* The taxi driver calls you because he is lost.

Context: You are talking to a new neighbor who is curious about what you do at work every day.
Correction: Helper will recast "I fix car" to "My main task is to fix engines and check the oil."

Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Daily Task" verbs and "I have to."

* List three main tasks you do at work.
* Say "It is hard work" or "It is interesting" three times.
AI helper script: I will say a job (e.g., "Teacher"). You say one thing that person "has to" do (e.g., "She has to help students").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a description of job duties.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I am a chef. Every day, I have to cook lunch for fifty people. I also have to order food and clean the kitchen."

* Repeat the "I also have to..." sentence.
* Practice the phrase "My main task is..." after the helper models it.
AI helper script: Model a description of your own job or a common one. Use "Every day," "I have to," and "I also." Speak at a natural but slow speed.

PHASE 3

Minutes: 20

* Describe two things you "have to" do every day.
* Mention one thing you "like" or "don't like" about your tasks.
* Repeat the simulation, but pretend you are a "Farmer" or "Doctor."
AI helper script: Act as a curious neighbor. Ask: "Do you work with a team?" and "Is it a busy job?" and "What tools do you use?" If I miss the "s" on "tasks," recast it.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "I have to" for obligations.
Human steps:

* Record: "I am a mechanic. I have to fix engines. I also have to talk to customers. It is a busy job."
* Listen: Did you use "have to" correctly?
* Write your two main work tasks in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the verb "have to" if the pronunciation was off. Give a "can-do" check for describing work.

Twists:

* You are looking for a new job.
* You work from home.
* You have to wear a uniform.
* You have a very mean boss.
* You have to work on weekends.

Title: Asking for a Wi-Fi Password (A2)
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can make simple requests and understand short instructions.
Context: You are in a city library or cafe and need to use the internet for a specific task.
Correction: Helper will recast "What password?" to "Could you tell me the Wi-Fi password, please?"

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill letters, numbers, and "Connection" words.
Human steps:

* Say "Connection," "Password," "Username," and "Lower-case" five times each.
* Practice spelling your own name out loud three times.
* Say "The internet is not working" five times.
AI helper script: I will say a word and you spell it as fast as you can. This is for letter-sound speed.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a request and a spelled-out response.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Excuse me. Could I have the Wi-Fi password for the library?"
* Helper responds: "Sure. It is B-L-U-E... seven... four."
* Helper points and says: "The name of the network is 'Library-Free'."
* Identify the letters and numbers the helper used.
* Repeat the spelling back to the helper.
AI helper script: Model a request and response. The response must include a network name and a password that has both letters and numbers. Speak slowly.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully get and verify the connection info.
Human steps:

* Approach the helper and ask for the Wi-Fi details.
* Write down the password as the helper spells it.
* Ask "Is it all lower-case?" or "Is there a space?"
* Repeat the simulation, but this time the password is "very long."
AI helper script: Act as a librarian. Give me a network name and a password (e.g., "Apple!99"). If I get a letter wrong, correct me. Ask me "Did it work?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on clear letter/number pronunciation.
Human steps:

* Record: "Could you repeat the password? A-B-C... five? Okay, it's working now. Thank you!"
* Listen: Were the letters B/P or M/N distinct?
* Write "Lower-case" and "Capital" in your log.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast any letters that sounded like others. Provide a "can-do" check for the request.

Twists:

* You need to pay for 1 hour of use.
* The Wi-Fi only works near the window.
* You are using your "laptop," not your phone.
* The password changes every day.
* You have to sign in with your email address.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Describing Your Weekend Weather
Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can give a simple description of a familiar topic.
Context: You are talking to a colleague on Monday morning about the weather over the past weekend.
Correction: Helper will recast "It was rain" to "It was raining on Saturday, but Sunday was sunny."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill weather adjectives and "Past" forms.
Human steps:

* Say "Sunny," "Rainy," "Cloudy," and "Windy" five times each.
* Say "It was," "It was not," and "The weather was..." ten times.
* List the days: "Yesterday," "On Saturday," "On Sunday."
AI helper script: I will say an adjective (e.g., "Hot"). You say "Yesterday was hot" or "It was hot on Saturday."

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Hear a description of past weather.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "On Saturday, the weather was very bad. It was raining all day. But on Sunday, it was sunny and warm."
* Listen for the contrast: "But."
* Identify which day was "bad" and which day was "good."
* Repeat the "It was raining all day" sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model a description of the weather for two days. Use "was" and "but." Speak at a natural but slow speed.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20
Purpose: Compare the weather of two different days.
Human steps:

* Tell the helper about the weather where you live (real or fake).
* Describe Saturday and Sunday using at least two different adjectives.
* Mention one thing you did because of the weather (e.g., "I stayed home because of the rain").
* Repeat the simulation, but pretend the weather was "crazy" (snow and sun).
AI helper script: Act as a colleague. Ask: "Did you go to the park?" and "Was it cold on Sunday?" If I say "It rain," recast it to "It was raining."

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "It was" + [ing/adjective].
Human steps:

* Record: "On Saturday, it was windy. On Sunday, it was sunny. We went for a walk. It was a nice weekend."
* Listen: Did you use "was" correctly for the past?
* Write "Sunny" and "Rainy" in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the weather words for better pronunciation. Give a "can-do" check for the description.

Twists:

* You were on vacation in a different city.
* The weather forecast was wrong.
* You like the rain.
* There was a big storm and the power went out.
* It is snowing (very rare).

* Practice numbers 1-10.

Name: Model and input

Purpose: Hear an explanation of library rules.

Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 20

* Repeat the simulation, but pretend you lost a book and have to report it.

Human steps:

* Record: "I can borrow three books. I must return them next week. The library opens at ten. Thank you."
* Listen: Did you distinguish between "can" (permission) and "must" (obligation)?
* Write your "Library Card" info in your notebook.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the modals if they were used wrong. Provide a "can-do" check for getting information.

Twists:

* You want to borrow a "Movie," not a book.
* The library is closed on Mondays.
* You have an old book from a different town.
* You need a quiet room for a meeting.
* The librarian is very strict and tells you to "Shh!".

Level: A2 (ACTFL Novice High–Intermediate Low; CLB 3–4)

Context: You are at a pharmacy or a clinic and need to explain a minor ailment like a cold.

Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill body parts and "Symptom" words.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input

* Repeat the "since Monday" phrase.

PHASE 3

Minutes: 20
Purpose: Successfully get advice or medicine for your cold.
Human steps:

* Explain your symptoms to the helper.
* Tell them when it started (e.g., "Yesterday morning").
* Ask if they have something to help (e.g., "Do you have medicine?").
* Repeat the simulation, but this time you are asking for your "Child" or "Parent."
AI helper script: Act as a pharmacist. Ask me: "Do you have a fever?" and "How long have you felt this way?" Give me an instruction: "Take this twice a day after eating."

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "I have a..."

Partner: Human or AI

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate the sound of an apology.

* Say "Excuse me" ten times.
* Practice "Are you okay?" three times.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
