Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can provide complex instructions and explain technical concepts in simple terms.
Context: You are an expert (in your real field) explaining a complex process to a new intern or a client.
Correction: Helper will recast jargon (e.g., "The API is down") to "The connection between the two programs is currently broken."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Analogy" phrases and simplification.
Human steps:

* Say "Think of it like a...", "Essentially, what happens is," and "In other words" five times each.
* List three complex words from your job and their "simple" definitions.
* Say "Does that make sense so far?" three times.
AI helper script: I will say a technical word from your industry. You must give me a 5-word "layperson" definition immediately. Let's do ten words.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a complex topic made accessible.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Encryption is like putting a letter in a locked box. Only the person with the key can read it. It prevents strangers from seeing your private data."
* Listen for the analogy ("like putting a letter...") and the purpose ("It prevents...").
* Repeat the analogy sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model an explanation of a complex topic (e.g., Cloud Computing or Irrigation). Use "analogy," "mechanism," "simplified," and "function." Speak at a patient, clear speed.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Teach a 5-minute lesson on a core part of your work.
Human steps:

* Choose a real task from your job (e.g., coding a function, fixing a pipe, managing a budget).
* Explain the "how" and "why" using at least two analogies.
* Check for understanding after each major point.
* Repeat the simulation, but the "client" is very confused and asks the same question three times.
AI helper script: Act as a confused but interested client. Ask: "But why can't we just do it the old way?" and "What happens if this part breaks?" If I use jargon, stop me and say "Wait, what does that word mean?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on the "Analogies."
Human steps:

* Record: "Essentially, the system works like a heart. It pumps data to all the different parts of the company so everyone stays informed."
* Listen: Was the analogy helpful?
* Write down one "Jargon" word and its "Simple" version.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the explanation to be even clearer. Give me a "can-do" check for instructional clarity.

Twists:

* You have to explain it using only a pen and a napkin (gestures only).
* The client is a child.
* You realize your explanation is actually technically wrong halfway through.
* The client is trying to "show off" and uses even more jargon than you.
* You have to explain it over a very bad phone connection.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

BEGIN PERFECT HOUR SESSION
Title: Narrating a Cultural Misunderstanding
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can narrate a complex story with subplots and nuances.
Context: You are at a dinner party telling a story about a time you traveled and completely misunderstood a local custom.
Correction: Helper will recast "I was confused" to "I was completely oblivious to the social etiquette of the situation."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice storytelling markers for B2 (nuance).
Human steps:

* Say "As it turns out," "Little did I know," and "Looking back on it" five times each.
* Say "It was quite embarrassing at the time" and "The irony was..." three times.
* Practice "To make matters worse" twice.
AI helper script: I will say "And then?" You give me one "twist" in a story (e.g., "And then I realized I was in the wrong house").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a narrative with psychological depth.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I thought the man was waving at me, so I waved back. Little did I know, that gesture is actually an insult in that village. I spent the whole day wondering why everyone was angry."
* Listen for the "Internal Thought vs. External Reality" contrast.
* Repeat the "Little did I know..." sentence.
AI helper script: Model a story about a cultural gaffe. Use "misinterpretation," "nuance," "etiquette," and "revelation." Speak with a storytelling rhythm.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Tell a 4-minute story with a "Moral" at the end.
Human steps:

* Set the scene (where, when, why you were there).
* Describe the "incident" and your internal thoughts at the time.
* Describe the "moment of realization" when you found out you were wrong.
* Explain what you learned about that culture (or about yourself).
* Repeat the story, but make it more dramatic and funny for a "larger" audience.
AI helper script: Act as a group of friends. React with "Oh no!" and "What happened next?" Ask: "How did you fix the mistake?" and "Did you ever go back?"

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "As it turns out" and "I realized."
Human steps:

* Record: "I was bowing, but in that country, you are supposed to shake hands. As it turns out, I looked very strange to them! I realized my mistake later that night."
* Listen: Did you capture the "humor" and "nuance"?
* Write down the most important cultural lesson from the story.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the sentences to use more sophisticated past tense forms (e.g., "I had been assuming..."). Give me a "can-do" check for narrative complexity.

Twists:

* The person you are telling the story to is from that same culture.
* You have to tell the story while someone is constantly interrupting.
* You realize mid-story that you've told this same person the story before.
* The story involves a romantic misunderstanding.
* You have to tell the story in exactly 60 seconds.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

BEGIN PERFECT HOUR SESSION
Title: Discussing the Impact of AI on Work
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can express and support complex opinions on abstract social issues.
Context: You are at a professional networking event debating whether AI will replace or help workers in your industry.
Correction: Helper will recast "AI is fast" to "The implementation of AI will likely automate routine tasks while creating new opportunities for creative problem-solving."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Speculative" language (might, likely, potential).
Human steps:

* Say "It's highly likely that," "There is a significant potential for," and "One could argue that" five times each.
* List five "AI-vulnerable" and five "Human-only" skills.
* Say "On a global scale" and "In the long run" three times.
AI helper script: I am a pessimist. I say "AI will take all the jobs." You must respond with a speculative "balanced" view (e.g., "While some jobs will go, others will be created").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a balanced, academic-lite argument.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "While AI can process data faster than any human, it lacks emotional intelligence. Therefore, I believe roles involving empathy and leadership are safe for now."
* Listen for the "While [A], however [B]. Therefore [C]" structure.
* Repeat the "emotional intelligence" and "safe for now" phrases.
AI helper script: Model a brief academic argument. Use "automation," "disruption," "augment," and "indispensable." Speak at a professional, thoughtful speed.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Debate the future of your specific career for 10 minutes.
Human steps:

* State your position on how AI affects your actual job.
* Provide two pros and two cons of AI integration in your field.
* Respond to the helper's "doom and gloom" scenarios with logical rebuttals.
* Repeat the simulation, but this time you are an AI developer trying to sell the technology to a skeptical boss.
AI helper script: Act as a skeptical colleague. Ask: "But won't the machine make more mistakes?" and "Why should we pay for this technology?" Push me to define what "Human value" really means in 2025.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Therefore" and "Consequently."
Human steps:

* Record: "AI can handle the administrative tasks; consequently, we will have more time for strategy. Therefore, I see it as a tool, not a replacement."
* Listen: Was your logic easy to follow?
* Write down one "abstract" word you learned (e.g., "Augmentation").
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the argument to be more formal. Give me a "can-do" check for abstract debating.

Twists:

* You find out the helper is actually an AI (it's a joke!).
* The government just passed a law banning AI in your industry.
* You realize you are talking to someone who just lost their job to AI.
* You have to explain AI to someone who doesn't use a computer.
* You are asked to give a 1-minute summary of the debate to a large group.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

BEGIN PERFECT HOUR SESSION
Title: Applying for a Small Business Loan
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can request and discuss detailed information to collaborate on a project.
Context: You are at a regional bank meeting with a loan officer to fund your new business idea.
Correction: Helper will recast "I need money for shop" to "I am seeking a line of credit to facilitate the initial startup costs of my venture."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill "Business Finance" vocabulary.
Human steps:

* Say "Revenue projections," "Collateral," "Interest rate," and "Business plan" five times each.
* Say "We anticipate a profit within..." and "Our target market is..." three times.
* Practice "What are the repayment terms?" twice.
AI helper script: I am a loan officer. Every time I say "That's a risk," you give me one "security" feature of your plan (e.g., "Experienced team," "Low overhead").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a professional business justification.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Our data shows a high demand for organic grain in this village. We have secured two major local buyers already. Consequently, the risk for this loan is very low."
* Listen for "secured," "consequently," and "risk."
* Repeat the "high demand" and "secured buyers" phrases.
AI helper script: Model a business loan request. Use "capital," "liability," "market saturation," and "projections." Speak with a confident, financial-expert tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Convince the bank to give you the loan.
Human steps:

* Present your business idea in detail (What, Why, Who).
* Explain exactly how you will spend the loan money.
* Discuss your "repayment plan" and what happens if the business is slow at first.
* Repeat the simulation, but the bank officer is very conservative and doesn't like your industry.
AI helper script: Act as a bank officer. Ask me: "What is your backup plan if the market changes?" and "How much of your own money are you investing?" Be tough but fair.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "In order to" and "So that."
Human steps:

* Record: "We need the capital in order to buy the equipment so that we can start production by June. This will ensure we meet the summer demand."
* Listen: Did you use "in order to" correctly?
* Write down the interest rate and the loan amount you "won."
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the pitch to sound more like a seasoned entrepreneur. Give me a "can-do" check for professional request-making.

Twists:

* Your business partner pulls out of the deal during the meeting.
* The interest rate just went up this morning.
* The bank officer used to work in your industry and knows all the "secrets."
* You realize you forgot your main financial chart.
* The loan is approved, but only for 50% of the amount.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

BEGIN PERFECT HOUR SESSION
Title: Explaining a Legal Dispute (Neighbor Edition)
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can recognize and appropriately respond to situations involving the needs and attitudes of others.
Context: Your neighbor’s tree fell on your fence. You are discussing who should pay for the repairs based on the local laws.
Correction: Helper will recast "Pay for my fence" to "I’ve looked into the local bylaws, and it seems the responsibility for the damage lies with the tree owner."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Legal and Responsibility" phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "Liability," "Bylaw," "Property line," and "Insurance claim" five times each.
* Say "I don't want to be difficult, but," and "From a legal standpoint" three times each.
* Practice "Let's find a fair solution" twice.
AI helper script: I am the neighbor. I say "It's not my fault, it was the wind!" You respond with a phrase that points back to the law or a "fair solution."

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a calm, evidence-based dispute.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I checked the city website, and since the tree was on your property, the maintenance was your responsibility. However, I’m happy to help you clear the branches."
* Listen for the "Law -> Responsibility -> Compromise" structure.
* Repeat the "maintenance was your responsibility" line.
AI helper script: Model a neighborhood dispute resolution. Use "property boundaries," "negligence," "resolution," and "mutually beneficial." Speak with a firm but neighborly tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Reach an agreement without calling a lawyer.
Human steps:

* Present the facts of the situation (when it happened, the damage).
* Explain what you found out about the local laws/rules.
* Propose a 50/50 split or a specific action (e.g., "You pay for materials, I do the work").
* Repeat the simulation, but the neighbor is very angry and starts shouting.
AI helper script: Act as a neighbor. First, be a bit cheap but reasonable. Then, repeat the scene and be very aggressive. Force me to stay calm and use "de-escalation" language.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "De-escalation" phrases.
Human steps:

* Record: "I understand you're upset, but let's focus on the fence. I've already checked the rules, and I'd like to find a way to fix this today."
* Listen: Did your voice stay calm during the "angry" part?
* Write down the compromise you reached.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the de-escalation to be even more effective. Give me a "can-do" check for conflict management.

Twists:

* The tree actually fell because of a storm that hit the whole town.
* You realize the fence was already a bit broken before the tree fell.
* A third neighbor comes over to watch the argument.
* You find out the neighbor is actually a lawyer.
* The tree is a "protected species" and you aren't allowed to move it.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Hosting a Community Town Hall
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can manage a variety of situations involving the feelings and attitudes of others.
Context: You are the moderator for a meeting about a new local construction project that some people hate.
Correction: Helper will recast "Quiet down" to "I’d like to ensure everyone has an opportunity to speak, one at a time, please."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Moderator" phrases for a group.
Human steps:

* Say "Let's keep this civil," "One at a time," and "Thank you for your input" five times each.
* Say "I'm going to pass the microphone to..." and "Can you summarize your point?" three times.
* Practice "We are here to listen" twice.
AI helper script: I am a rowdy crowd. I will shout out different complaints (e.g., "It's too loud!" "Waste of money!"). You must use a moderator phrase to keep order.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear how to handle multiple perspectives.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I hear your concerns about the traffic. Now, let's hear from the engineering team about their plan to reduce noise. Please, let's let them finish."
* Listen for the transition between "The People" and "The Experts."
* Repeat the "I hear your concerns... now let's hear from..." structure.
AI helper script: Model a moderator's introduction and a transition. Use "agenda," "consensus," "floor is open," and "perspective." Speak with a neutral, loud, and clear voice.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Run a 10-minute "Town Hall" and keep everyone calm.
Human steps:

* Introduce the topic and the "rules" of the meeting (time limits, no shouting).
* Call on different "people" (the helper) and summarize their points for the record.
* Deal with an "interrupter" who won't stop talking.
* Repeat the simulation, but now the construction manager (helper) is being rude to the citizens.
AI helper script: Act as three different people: An angry resident, a bored teenager, and a defensive project manager. Cycle through them quickly. Force me to keep the meeting moving and on-topic.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Summarizing and Transitioning."
Human steps:

* Record: "Thank you for your comment on the budget. Now, we will move on to the environmental impact. Does anyone have a question on that topic?"
* Listen: Did you sound like you were in control of the room?
* Write down one phrase you used to "cut off" a long-winded speaker.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the transitions for better flow. Give me a "can-do" check for group facilitation.

Twists:

* The microphone stops working.
* Someone starts crying because they are losing their house.
* You realize the "Construction Plan" you are looking at is the wrong version.
* The meeting has to end 20 minutes early.
* Everyone suddenly agrees on one thing!
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

BEGIN PERFECT HOUR SESSION
Title: Formally Resigning from a Position
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate to handle a variety of formal personal and business matters.
Context: You are meeting with your manager to submit your resignation and discuss the transition of your responsibilities.
Correction: Helper will recast "I am leaving" to "I am writing to formally resign from my position, effective [Date]."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Automate professional exit phrases and transition talk.
Human steps:

* Say "I’ve decided to move on," "I appreciate the opportunity," and "How can I help with the handover?" five times each.
* Say "My last day will be..." and "I will ensure a smooth transition" three times.
* Practice "I'd like to discuss the next steps" twice.
AI helper script: I am your manager. I will say "How is your work going?" You must break the news of your resignation professionally and offer a specific handover plan.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a balanced resignation that preserves professional relationships.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I’m meeting with you today because I’ve accepted a new role elsewhere. I want to thank you for the support here. I’ve prepared a handover document to assist the team."
* Listen for "accepted a new role," "handover document," and "assist the team."
* Repeat the "handover" sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model a professional resignation meeting. Use "formal resignation," "effective date," "transition period," and "professional growth." Speak with a respectful, confident tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Negotiate the notice period and the transition tasks.
Human steps:

* Deliver the news of your departure to the "manager."
* Explain your reasons briefly (focusing on growth/new challenges).
* Propose a timeline for finishing your current projects.
* Repeat the simulation, but the manager is very upset because you are leaving during a busy week.
AI helper script: Act as a manager. First, be supportive but curious. Then, repeat the scene and be stressed, saying "You can't leave now, we have the audit!" Force me to negotiate my final date or the volume of work I can finish.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "I'll ensure" and "I'm committed to."
Human steps:

* Record: "I am committed to a smooth transition. I’ll ensure that all my files are organized for the next person. Thank you for the opportunity to work here."
* Listen: Did you sound firm but helpful?
* Write down the name of your successor or the handover tasks.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the transition promises to sound more proactive. Give me a "can-do" check for professional etiquette.

Twists:

* The company offers you a counter-offer to stay.
* You have to tell the manager you are going to a direct competitor.
* You want to leave one week earlier than your contract allows.
* The manager asks you to train your replacement starting tomorrow.
* You are asked to participate in an "exit interview" right now.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Interviewing a Potential Employee
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can ask for and provide detailed information to collaborate or advise.
Context: You are a department head interviewing a candidate for a junior role in your team.
Correction: Helper will recast "Tell me work" to "Could you walk me through your relevant experience in this field?"

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice interviewer "Lead" phrases and evaluation terms.
Human steps:

* Say "Tell me about a time when...", "How would you handle...", and "What are your strengths?" five times each.
* Say "That’s a good example," and "Could you elaborate on that?" three times.
* Practice "We are looking for someone who..." twice.
AI helper script: I am a job candidate. You ask me one interview question. I will give a short answer. You must then ask a follow-up question based on my answer.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a professional interviewer structure the conversation.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "Thank you for coming in. To start, could you describe a challenging situation you faced at your last job and how you resolved it?"
* Listen for "challenging situation," "resolved," and "walk me through."
* Repeat the "challenging situation" prompt three times.
AI helper script: Model a professional interview opening and a behavioral question. Use "competencies," "track record," "elaborate," and "fit." Speak with an encouraging but analytical tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Conduct a 10-minute interview and decide if you would hire the person.
Human steps:

* Welcome the candidate and introduce the role.
* Ask three behavioral questions (e.g., about conflict, mistakes, or deadlines).
* Respond to the candidate's questions about the company culture.
* Repeat the simulation, but the candidate is very nervous and gives very short answers.
AI helper script: Act as a candidate. At first, be a strong candidate. Then, repeat the scene and be very shy/nervous. Force me to ask better, more open-ended questions to get you to speak.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Could you elaborate" and "What I'm looking for."
Human steps:

* Record: "What I'm looking for is someone with initiative. Could you elaborate on your experience with project management? Thank you."
* Listen: Did you sound like a leader?
* Write down the "Hiring Decision" and one reason why.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the prompts to make them more professional. Give me a "can-do" check for leadership communication.

Twists:

* The candidate is overqualified and asks for a very high salary.
* The candidate mentions they worked for your biggest rival.
* You realize the candidate is a friend of your boss.
* The candidate’s phone rings during the interview.
* You have to explain that the job requires frequent travel to remote villages.

Title: Negotiating a Business Partnership
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can request, provide, and discuss detailed information to collaborate on complex projects.
Context: You are a local producer meeting with a regional distributor to get your products into town shops.
Correction: Helper will recast "I want sell" to "I’m looking to establish a partnership that expands our mutual market reach."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill partnership and contract vocabulary.
Human steps:

* Say "Mutual benefit," "Exclusivity clause," "Profit margins," and "Distribution network" five times each.
* Say "What I can offer is," and "What I need from you is" three times each.
* Practice "Let's look at the numbers" twice.
AI helper script: I am a distributor. I will say "The market is too crowded." You must respond with one "unique selling point" of your product (e.g., "It's organic," "Lower price").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a negotiation focused on logistics and value.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "We produce the highest quality grain in the village. If you handle the transport, we can offer a twenty percent discount for the first six months. Is that feasible?"
* Listen for "highest quality," "handle the transport," and "feasible."
* Repeat the "Is that feasible?" question three times.
AI helper script: Model a partnership pitch. Use "supply chain," "logistics," "commission," and "incentive." Speak with a sharp, business-oriented tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Reach an agreement on the profit split and delivery schedule.
Human steps:

* Pitch your product and explain why the distributor needs it.
* Negotiate the percentage they take as commission.
* Agree on a specific delivery day and location (e.g., "The warehouse in town").
* Repeat the simulation, but the distributor wants you to pay for the fuel costs.
AI helper script: Act as a tough distributor. Ask: "Why should I pick you over the big companies?" and "What happens if you can't deliver on time?" Be stubborn about the price.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Provided that" and "As long as."
Human steps:

* Record: "As long as you provide the truck, I can provide the grain. Provided that we meet our targets, we can discuss a new contract in December."
* Listen: Did the conditions ("As long as") sound clear?
* Write down the "Contract Terms" you agreed on.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the conditions for better legal/business flow. Give me a "can-do" check for collaborative negotiation.

Twists:

* The distributor wants "exclusive" rights to sell your product.
* You find out the distributor is already working with your brother/sister.
* A sudden road closure makes delivery to town impossible.
* You want to be paid in cash, but they only do bank transfers.
* They ask you to change your packaging to match their brand.

Title: Appealing a Denied Medical Claim
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can communicate to handle a variety of complex service issues.
Context: You received a bill for a surgery or treatment that your insurance was supposed to cover, but they denied it.
Correction: Helper will recast "It's free" to "This procedure was pre-authorized and should be covered under my current plan."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice insurance codes and medical justification.
Human steps:

* Say "Pre-authorization," "Coverage limit," "Deductible," and "Appeal" five times each.
* Say "This was medically necessary," and "There must be an error" three times.
* Practice "I have the doctor's note right here" twice.
AI helper script: I am an insurance agent. I say "This treatment is considered cosmetic." You respond with a medical reason why it was necessary (e.g., "It was for a broken bone").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Understand how to navigate a bureaucratic medical dispute.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I’m calling about bill number 456. My doctor confirmed this was an emergency procedure. Why was it denied as a non-essential service?"
* Listen for "confirmed," "emergency procedure," and "denied as."
* Repeat the "Why was it denied...?" question three times.
AI helper script: Model a call to a medical insurance company. Use "billing department," "out-of-network," "claim status," and "reimbursement." Speak with a firm, serious tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Get the agent to review the doctor’s notes and re-process the claim.
Human steps:

* State the date of the procedure and the specific bill amount.
* Explain the medical urgency of the treatment.

Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can handle a complex service matter and negotiate a resolution.
Context: Your water bill is four times higher than usual. You are calling the utility company to demand an inspection.
Correction: Helper will recast "Bill is too much" to "I am calling to report a significant discrepancy in my most recent billing cycle."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill "Utility and Measurement" vocabulary.
Human steps:

* Say "Billing cycle," "Meter reading," "Consumption," and "Anomaly" five times each.
* Say "This does not reflect my actual usage" and "I suspect a leak or a faulty meter" three times.
* Practice "I request an on-site technician immediately" twice.
AI helper script: I am a customer service agent. I say "Maybe you just used more water." You respond with a logical reason why that's impossible (e.g., "I was on vacation").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a detailed, persistent technical complaint.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "My average consumption is fifty units, but this bill shows two hundred. I checked my pipes and found no leaks. Therefore, I believe the meter is malfunctioning."
* Listen for "average consumption," "no leaks," and "malfunctioning."
* Repeat the "average consumption is... but this shows..." structure.
AI helper script: Model a call to a utility company. Use "usage history," "adjustment," "technician," and "escalate." Speak with a firm, professional speed.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Get the company to waive the fee and send a repair person.
Human steps:

* Provide your account number and state the exact dollar amount of the overcharge.
* Compare your current bill to your usage history from last year.
* Refuse to pay the bill until the meter is inspected.
* Repeat the simulation, but the agent says "You have to pay first and we will refund you later" (refuse this).
AI helper script: Act as a bureaucratic agent. Use "standard procedure" as a shield. Force me to explain why I cannot pay the bill now and why it is their responsibility to prove the usage.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "I suspect that" and "I'm not prepared to."
Human steps:

* Record: "I suspect that the meter is faulty. I am not prepared to pay the bill until an inspection is conducted. Please provide a case number."
* Listen: Did you sound like a confident consumer?
* Write down the "Case Number" and "Technician Name."
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the sentences to be more authoritative. Give me a "can-do" check for handling a complex matter.

Twists:

* You realize you actually left a hose running in the garden.
* The agent tells you there was a price increase you were never told about.
* You find out the whole neighborhood has the same problem.
* The technician arrives but says they can't find the meter.
* You are calling from a remote village with a very weak phone signal.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Discussing Regional Economic Changes
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can express and support complex opinions on abstract social and economic issues.
Context: You are talking to a colleague or local leader about how a new factory in a nearby town will change your village.
Correction: Helper will recast "It brings jobs" to "The influx of industry will likely stimulate the local economy while putting pressure on our infrastructure."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Economic Impact" and "Speculation" terms.
Human steps:

* Say "Infrastructure," "Cost of living," "Labor market," and "Sustainable growth" five times each.
* Say "On a positive note," and "Conversely, we must consider..." three times each.
* Practice "This will have a profound impact on..." twice.
AI helper script: I am a local leader. I will say "The factory is good news." You must provide one "Con" or "Risk" associated with the change (e.g., "Pollution," "Traffic").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a balanced analysis of regional development.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "While the factory will create five hundred jobs, I’m concerned about the rising rent in our village. We need to implement rent controls before the factory opens."
* Listen for "While... I'm concerned about," "implement," and "infrastructure."
* Repeat the "While... I'm concerned about..." structure three times.
AI helper script: Model a brief economic analysis. Use "demographic shift," "incentives," "urbanization," and "mitigation." Speak with a thoughtful, analytical tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Debate the future of the village for 10 minutes and propose a plan.
Human steps:

* Present your view on the "Big Picture" of the factory's arrival.
* Discuss the potential impact on young people vs. the elderly in the village.
* Suggest two specific ways the village can prepare (e.g., more housing, better roads).
* Repeat the simulation, but the "Leader" is only interested in the taxes the factory will pay.
AI helper script: Act as a pro-business local leader. Be obsessed with "Revenue" and "Taxes." Force me to argue for the "Human" and "Environmental" side of the debate.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "From an economic perspective" and "Looking at the social impact."
Human steps:

* Record: "From an economic perspective, the factory is a win. However, looking at the social impact, we must protect our quiet way of life. We need a balance."
* Listen: Was your argument nuanced or one-sided?
* Write down one new "Economic" word you used.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the argument to be more academic-lite. Give me a "can-do" check for abstract debating.

Twists:

* You find out the factory belongs to a company you dislike.
* The factory is being built on your family's old land.
* The news reports that the factory might not open after all.
* A group of protesters asks you to join them.
* You realize your own job might be replaced by the factory's machines.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Advocating for an Aging Parent's Care
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can request and discuss detailed information to advise or counsel on a personal matter.
Context: You are meeting with a hospital administrator or social worker to discuss your parent's discharge and home-care needs.
Correction: Helper will recast "They need help" to "I am concerned about my parent's ability to maintain their daily routine without professional support."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill "Healthcare and Advocacy" vocabulary.
Human steps:

* Say "Mobility," "Medication management," "Home-care assessment," and "Rehabilitation" five times each.
* Say "I am my parent's primary advocate" and "What are the long-term options?" three times.
* Practice "We need a clear discharge plan" twice.
AI helper script: I am a busy social worker. I say "They are ready to go home." You respond with a specific "at-home risk" (e.g., "The stairs," "The memory issues").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a firm, compassionate medical advocacy.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "My father lives in a remote village with no easy access to a pharmacy. We need a plan for medication delivery before he leaves the hospital. Is that possible?"
* Listen for "remote village," "access to," "medication delivery," and "leaves the hospital."
* Repeat the "We need a plan for... before..." structure three times.
AI helper script: Model a meeting between a family member and a doctor. Use "holistic," "continuum of care," "adherence," and "support network." Speak with a serious, empathetic tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Secure a 3-day extension in the hospital or a daily home-care visit.
Human steps:

* Describe your parent's current home situation in detail.
* List three specific tasks they cannot do themselves (e.g., cooking, bathing).
* Negotiate for a specific service (like a visiting nurse) to be covered by the city/insurance.
* Repeat the simulation, but the administrator says "There are no funds available."
AI helper script: Act as a hospital administrator. Use "budget constraints" as your main argument. Force me to use "if... then..." logic (e.g., "If they go home now, they will just come back to the ER tomorrow").

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Under these circumstances" and "I require."
Human steps:

* Record: "Under these circumstances, I require a professional home-care assessment. We cannot risk a fall. Thank you for your cooperation."
* Listen: Did you sound firm and protective?
* Write down the name of the "Social Worker."
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the advocacy for better impact. Give me a "can-do" check for handling a demanding personal matter.

Twists:

* Your parent says they don't want any "strangers" in their house.
* You realize you are the only person who can provide the care (how do you feel?).
* The hospital is in a different town and you have to travel back and forth.
* A nurse tells you a "secret" about a better care home nearby.
* Your siblings disagree with your plan.

Title: Navigating a Medical Emergency Abroad
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can provide complex instructions and explain technical concepts in a demanding situation.
Context: You are at a foreign hospital. A friend has a severe allergic reaction, and you must explain their medical history to a doctor.
Correction: Helper will recast "They are sick" to "My friend is experiencing anaphylaxis and has a history of severe nut allergies."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill "Emergency and Medical" terminology.
Human steps:

* Say "Allergic reaction," "Shortness of breath," "Medical history," and "Anaphylaxis" five times each.
* Say "They are on medication for..." and "They have no prior history of..." three times.
* Practice "I have their travel insurance details here" twice.
AI helper script: I am an ER doctor. I say "What happened?" You give me a 30-second summary of the symptoms and the cause (e.g., "They ate a cookie, then their throat closed").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Understand how to communicate critical health data fast.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "The patient is allergic to penicillin and nuts. They were fine until ten minutes ago. I noticed swelling in the face and difficulty breathing. Please check their pulse."
* Listen for "allergic to," "until ten minutes ago," "noticed swelling," and "difficulty breathing."
* Repeat the "allergic to [A] and [B]" list three times.
AI helper script: Model an emergency medical report. Use "unconscious," "intervention," "vitals," and "complications." Speak with a fast, urgent, but professional tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Get the doctor to administer the right medicine and call the insurance.
Human steps:

* Describe the timeline of the "attack" from the first symptom to now.
* Translate any "technical" words from your friend's medical ID if necessary.
* Negotiate the "payment" or "insurance" issue so they don't stop the treatment.
* Repeat the simulation, but the doctor thinks it's just "food poisoning" and isn't acting fast.
AI helper script: Act as a doctor who is a bit too relaxed. Say "It's probably just the heat." Force me to be extremely firm and descriptive to prove it is a real emergency.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "It is critical that" and "As I mentioned."
Human steps:

* Record: "It is critical that you check the allergy list. As I mentioned, they cannot have penicillin. I will call the embassy now."
* Listen: Did your voice stay steady under pressure?
* Write down the "Room Number" and "Doctor's Name."
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the urgency for better clarity. Give me a "can-do" check for handling a demanding situation.

Twists:

* You realize you also ate the same food and are starting to feel sick.
* The hospital doesn't have the specific medicine you need.
* You have to explain this over a video call to the friend's family.
* The insurance company won't answer the phone.
* The doctor asks you to sign a paper in a language you don't know.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Title: Addressing a Breach of Office Confidentiality
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can manage and mediate conflict and handle formal business matters.
Context: You found out a colleague shared a private project document with an outsider. You must have a "closed-door" meeting with them.
Correction: Helper will recast "Why you tell them?" to "I need to discuss a serious concern regarding a breach of our non-disclosure agreement."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Integrity and Accountability" phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "Confidentiality," "Non-disclosure," "Breach of trust," and "Consequences" five times each.
* Say "This is a serious matter" and "I'm very disappointed in this behavior" three times.
* Practice "How did this happen?" twice.
AI helper script: I am the colleague. I say "It was just a small document." You respond with a phrase that emphasizes the "legal or professional impact" of their action.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a firm, disciplinary-lite conversation.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "I’ve been informed that the Smith files were sent to a competitor. This violates our company policy and puts our project at risk. I need an explanation immediately."
* Listen for "informed that," "violates," "at risk," and "explanation."
* Repeat the "violates our company policy" phrase three times.
AI helper script: Model a serious meeting about confidentiality. Use "sensitive data," "protocol," "implications," and "accountability." Speak with a cold, professional tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Get an honest confession and agree on a "Correction Plan."
Human steps:

* Present the "evidence" of the breach (e.g., an email or a witness report).
* Explain the potential damage to the company (lost money, lost trust).
* Decide whether to report this to HR or handle it internally with a warning.
* Repeat the simulation, but the colleague blames you for leaving the file open.
AI helper script: Act as a defensive colleague. Be "Casual" at first, then "Angry." Say "Everyone does it!" Force me to stay professional and refer back to the "Employee Handbook."

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "There will be" and "Moving forward."
Human steps:

* Record: "There will be a formal note on your record. Moving forward, I expect you to follow all security protocols. This cannot happen again."
* Listen: Did you sound like a manager who can be trusted?
* Write down the "Action Items" (e.g., "Change passwords").
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the discipline for better authority. Give me a "can-do" check for mediation and conflict.

Twists:

* The "outsider" who got the file is actually your boss's best friend.
* The colleague was trying to help a client, not hurt the company.
* You realize you also made a small mistake on the same project.
* The colleague starts to pack their bags to quit.
* The information is already all over social media.

Title: Terminating a Long-Term Service Contract
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can negotiate complex conditions and handle formal business/service matters.
Context: You are canceling a contract for an expensive software or service that has consistently failed to perform.
Correction: Helper will recast "I want stop" to "I am calling to formally terminate our agreement due to persistent service failures."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Drill "Contractual Termination" vocabulary.
Human steps:

* Say "Termination clause," "Notice period," "Non-performance," and "Refund" five times each.
* Say "I have documented three separate failures," and "This is not what was promised" three times.
* Practice "I will not be paying the cancellation fee" twice.
AI helper script: I am a service manager. I say "We can fix it! Give us another month." You respond with a phrase that explains why "trust is broken" and you want to leave now.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a firm, legal-lite service cancellation.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "As per section eight of our contract, I am giving my thirty-day notice. The service has been down for ten days this month. I expect a pro-rated refund."
* Listen for "As per section," "thirty-day notice," and "pro-rated refund."
* Repeat the "pro-rated refund" phrase three times.
AI helper script: Model a contract termination call. Use "breach of contract," "stipulated," "compensation," and "discontinued." Speak with a firm, business-like tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Cancel the contract and avoid the "early exit" fee.
Human steps:

* State the specific dates when the service failed.
* Quote the "fictional" contract rule that allows you to leave for free.
* Negotiate a final "close-out" date for the account.
* Repeat the simulation, but the manager says "You are in a two-year lock-in and must pay $2000 to leave."
AI helper script: Act as a persistent manager. Use "fine print" as an excuse. Force me to mention "Legal Action" or "Social Media Reviews" to get my way.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "As I mentioned previously" and "In accordance with."
Human steps:

* Record: "In accordance with our agreement, I am terminating the service. As I mentioned previously, I will not be paying the exit fee. Please confirm receipt."
* Listen: Was your tone clear and unyielding?
* Write down the "Cancellation Reference Number."
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the termination for better legal weight. Give me a "can-do" check for professional service negotiation.

Twists:

* The manager offers you the service for free for six months to stay.
* You realize you actually missed the "cancellation window" by one day.
* The company's headquarters is in a different country with different laws.
* Your boss tells you at the last minute to "keep the service" (how do you pivot?).
* You find a better, cheaper service while you are on the phone.
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION

Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can express and support complex opinions on abstract social issues.
Context: You are at a community meeting debating if city workers moving to your remote village (digital nomads) is good or bad for the locals.
Correction: Helper will recast "New people are rich" to "The rise of remote work is driving up local property values, which may displace long-term residents."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Sociological and Economic" debate phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "Gentrification," "Digital nomads," "Local economy," and "Cultural friction" five times each.
* Say "On the one hand, they spend money," and "On the other hand, they change the culture" three times each.
* Practice "We need to find a sustainable way to integrate them" twice.
AI helper script: I am a village elder who hates the change. I say "These people don't care about our village." You respond with a balanced view (e.g., "They help the local shops survive").

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a nuanced discussion on community change.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "While the influx of remote workers brings new income to our cafés, it also makes it impossible for our children to buy homes here. We need a balance."
* Listen for "influx of," "brings new income," and "impossible for... to."
* Repeat the "balance between income and housing" sentence three times.
AI helper script: Model an abstract debate. Use "socio-economic," "disparity," "authenticity," and "integration." Speak with a thoughtful, serious tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Propose a "Community Rule" (e.g., a nomad tax or a local housing discount).
Human steps:

* Present two "Pros" and two "Cons" of the nomad trend in your village.
* Respond to the "Angry Elder" and the "Excited Shop Owner" (the helper).
* Suggest one specific policy the village council should implement.
* Repeat the simulation, but act as a "Digital Nomad" defending your presence to the village.
AI helper script: Act as three villagers: The Elder (angry), the Baker (happy for sales), and the Teacher (worried about school sizes). Force me to address all three perspectives in my speech.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "Taking all perspectives into account."
Human steps:

* Record: "Taking all perspectives into account, we should welcome the new workers but tax them to help local schools. This is a fair solution for everyone."
* Listen: Did you sound inclusive?
* Write down one "big" word you used (e.g., "Integration").
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the argument to be more formal. Give me a "can-do" check for abstract debating.

Twists:

* You are a remote worker yourself (how does this affect your bias?).
* The nomads start a project to build a new library for the village.
* One nomad behaves very disrespectfully during a local festival.
* The government announces a "Remote Work Grant" for the village.
* You realize the "Nomads" are actually your own children who moved back home.

Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Child Advocacy and School Policy" phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "Zero-tolerance policy," "Harassment," "Well-being," and "Supervision" five times each.

* Practice "I want a follow-up meeting in one week" twice.
AI helper script: I am the principal. I say "It's just kids being kids." You respond with a phrase that emphasizes the "seriousness and impact" of the behavior.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a firm, parental advocacy that uses "Policy" as a tool.
Human steps:

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus

* Listen: Did you sound like a strong advocate?
* Write down the name of the principal.
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the demand to be more professional. Give me a "can-do" check for handling a sensitive personal matter.

Twists:

* You find out the bully's parents are your close friends.
* The bullying is happening in a remote village school with only two teachers.
* You realize your child actually did something wrong first (how do you handle it?).
* The principal tells you the school has no money for extra guards.

Title: Negotiating Project Scope with a Client
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can request, provide, and discuss detailed information to collaborate on complex projects.
Context: A client keeps adding new features to a project without wanting to pay more (Scope Creep). You must set a boundary.
Correction: Helper will recast "No more work" to "I’d like to discuss how these additional requirements will affect our original budget and timeline."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Project Management and Boundary" phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "Project scope," "Timeline," "Resource allocation," and "Additional fees" five times each.
* Say "I’d love to include that, but it wasn't in the original contract" and "We need to adjust the price" three times.
* Practice "Let's stick to the agreed-upon plan" twice.
AI helper script: I am a client. I will say "Can you just add one more small thing?" You respond with a phrase that acknowledges the idea but mentions the "cost or time" impact.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear a professional boundary-setting conversation.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "That’s a great feature, but adding it now will delay the launch by two weeks. We can do it, but we’ll need to sign a new work order for the extra hours."
* Listen for "delay the launch," "work order," and "extra hours."
* Repeat the "We can do it, but we'll need to..." structure three times.
AI helper script: Model a scope-creep negotiation. Use "deliverables," "milestones," "out of scope," and "re-negotiate." Speak with a helpful but firm professional tone.

PHASE 3

Title: Explaining Idiomatic or Cultural Humor
Level: B2 (ACTFL Advanced Low–Mid; CLB 7–8)
Partner: Human or AI
Goal (CLB): I can express and support complex opinions and describe social nuances.
Context: A foreign visitor is confused by a joke or a saying everyone laughed at. You must explain the "hidden" meaning.
Correction: Helper will recast "It's a joke about..." to "This idiom relies on a cultural subtext regarding [Topic] that isn't immediately obvious."

PHASE 1
Name: Fluency loop
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Practice "Nuance and Subtext" phrases.
Human steps:

* Say "Double meaning," "Cultural subtext," "Sarcasm," and "Idiomatic expression" five times each.
* Say "It’s a play on words," and "You have to understand the history of..." three times.
* Practice "It's funny because..." twice.
AI helper script: I am a confused visitor. I will say "Why did they laugh?" about a phrase (e.g., "Break a leg"). You give me a 10-word explanation of the "hidden" meaning.

PHASE 2
Name: Model and input
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Hear an explanation of linguistic irony.
Human steps:

* Helper says: "When we say 'it's a piece of cake,' we don't mean food. It’s an idiom that refers to something being extremely easy. It dates back to the 1930s."
* Listen for "don't mean," "refers to," and "dates back to."
* Repeat the "It's an idiom that refers to..." structure three times.
AI helper script: Model an explanation of a complex idiom or cultural joke. Use "connotation," "etymology," "nuance," and "contextual." Speak with a warm, analytical tone.

PHASE 3
Name: Simulation output
Minutes: 30
Purpose: Successfully explain three different "difficult" cultural moments to the visitor.
Human steps:

* Choose an idiom or joke from your own culture.
* Explain the literal meaning vs. the cultural meaning.
* Describe the social situation where it is appropriate to use it.
* Repeat the simulation, but the visitor thinks the joke is "offensive" and you must defend it.
AI helper script: Act as a confused visitor. Be "Literal-minded." Say "But I don't want to break my leg!" Force me to explain the "Emotion and Intent" behind the words.

PHASE 4
Name: Record and focus
Minutes: 10
Purpose: Focus on "It's a play on..." and "It implies that..."
Human steps:

* Record: "It’s a play on the word 'bank.' It implies that the person is rich, but also a bit greedy. It's a very common joke in my village."
* Listen: Did you make the "nuance" clear?
* Write down the idiom and its "Definition."
AI helper script: Listen to the recording. Recast the explanation for better linguistic precision. Give me a "can-do" check for cultural narration.

Twists:

* The idiom is actually very old and only elders use it.
* You realize the joke is actually not funny when you explain it.
* The visitor tells you an even stranger joke from their country.
* You have to explain a joke about a local politician.
* The visitor wants to use the idiom immediately (but uses it wrong).
END PERFECT HOUR SESSION
